Description: Two fragments of highly burnished black top brown pottery vessel made of very fine Nile silt clay. One piece is the transition to the base (two fragments now joined); the other is a fragment of the rim (two fragments now joined) with 5 drill holes for repair.
Curator's comments: Type possibly like Black top brown BB31M in Brunton and Caton-Thompson 1928. Marked 5100 in pencil. Other fragments of this same vessel are registered as EA 59631.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (6)
